steps.text: Beat the eggs with salt and pepper. Heat a pan with a little oil, pour in the egg mixture, and tilt the pan to spread it into a thin, even layer.
tips: Use low heat to keep the omelette soft and tender.
Gently shake the pan to help the egg cook evenly.

steps.text: Dice bell peppers and ham/bacon. Melt a small amount of butter or oil in a pan and sauté the ingredients until fragrant.
tips: Do not overcook the filling—keep the vegetables slightly crisp for better texture.

steps.text: Transfer the sautéed filling onto one half of the cooked egg sheet.
tips: Keep the heat low so the egg bottom doesn’t over-brown.

steps.text: Fold the omelette in half and gently seal the edges. Sprinkle black pepper or herbs on top before serving.
tips: Do not press too hard—keeping the omelette fluffy is key.
Serve immediately to enjoy the best texture.
